revised_title: Preliminary Account of the Total Solar Eclipse of 1901
tldr: In this article, F. W. Dyson and F. R. S. describe the preliminary account of the total solar eclipse observed on May 18, 1901, at Pulo Aoer Gadang, West Coast of Sumatra. The observations were made by an expedition from the Royal Observatory, and the data collected helped to understand the behavior of the sun and the surrounding environment during the eclipse.
